questions.question: What was the event where British soldiers were taunted and teased and they opened fire on colonists?

choices.answer: The French and Indian War
The Proclamation of 1763
The Boston Tea Party
The Boston Massacre

questions.question: Why did the Proclamation Line of 1763 anger colonists?

choices.answer: It banned colonial trade with Natives.
It offered all land west of the Appalachians to British nobles only.
It prevented colonists from settling west of the Appalachians.
It took away all the fertile land.

questions.question: The Stamp Act, which was a law that placed taxes on all used papers, was put in place to-

choices.answer: Help pay the debt from the French and Indian War.
Pay Britain for establishing the colonies.
Help buy Britain more ships.
Pay for roads in the colonies.

questions.question: Which colonial region was most negatively affected by the policies put on the colonies after the French and Indian war?

choices.answer: New England Colonies
Middle Colonies
Southern Colonies
All colonial regions were affected equally.

questions.question: All of the following are characteristics of patriots EXCEPT-

choices.answer: Believed Britain was taking advantage of them economically.
Believed Britain protected them.
Were mainly in the New England colonies.
Wanted to develop a system of representative government with no king.

questions.question: What is happening in this picture?

choices.answer: Colonists were protesting the Stamp Act.
Colonists objected to the British taxes on tea.
American Indians were attacking the port of Boston.
American Indians were often hired to stow cargo on ships.

questions.question: What was the impact of the Boston Tea Party?

choices.answer: Britain passed the Intolerable Acts, leading to the American Revolution.
Americans began buying their tea and coffee from French merchants.
Britain lifted the duties on tea and submitted to all colonial demands.
British merchants boycotted all purchases of American-made goods.

questions.question: What did Thomas Paine try to get colonists to do?

choices.answer: Stay loyal to Britain
Pay taxes
Break free from Britain
Vote in Parliament

questions.question: What was the cause of the ceded land in this picture?

choices.answer: European Exploration
The French and Indian War
The Revolutionary War
The Battle of Saratoga

questions.question: The Treaty of Paris (1783)outlined all of the following EXCEPT-

choices.answer: Britain recognized the United States as its own country.
All British troops would leave the US.
Britain would still control trade with US.
US agreed to pay all debt it owed Britain.

questions.question: Which of the following did NOT contribute to the Continental Army's defeat over Britain?

choices.answer: Increased funding from the Continental Congress
Financial support from European countries
Military training from people like Marquis de Lafayette
Strong leadership from people like George Washington

questions.question: Who were the two main sides of the fight for independence in colonial society?

choices.answer: Federalists and Anti Federalists
Patriots and Loyalists
Rights that are given by government
Rights that you are born with
Rights that should be monitored
Rights from another planet
